types.name: App
types.description: An application in the Niftory ecosystem. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/app-and-appuser).

fields.name: contract
fields.description: The contract associated with this app.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: AppUser
types.description: Represents a user of a particular Niftory [App]({{Types.App}}). Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/app-and-appuser).

fields.name: app
fields.description: The app this user is scoped to.

fields.name: email
fields.description: This user's email.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The URL for this user's image.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The user's full name.

fields.name: wallet
fields.description: The wallet owned by this user.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: AppUserList
types.description: Represents a list of [AppUser]({{Types.AppUser}})s of a particular Niftory [App]({{Types.App}}). Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/app-and-appuser).

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page of results, if any.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The AppUsers in this list.

types.name: Attributable
types.description: An interface representing objects that have attributes property for non-blockchain property storage.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

types.name: Blockchain
types.description: The blockchains supported by Niftory.

enumValues.name: ETHEREUM
enumValues.description: The Ethereum blockchain. https://ethereum.org/en/

enumValues.name: FLOW
enumValues.description: The Flow blockchain. https://www.onflow.org/

enumValues.name: POLYGON
enumValues.description: The Polygon blockchain. https://polygon.technology/

types.name: BlockchainEntity
types.description: An interface representing properties common to all objects that exist on the blockchain

fields.name: blockchainId
fields.description: The ID of this resource on the blockchain.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: A mapping of properties that will be added to the blockchain.

types.name: BlockchainResource
types.description: An interface representing properties common to all objects that exist on the blockchain

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: blockchainId
fields.description: The ID of this resource on the blockchain.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: A mapping of properties that will be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this resource. Can be used to track progress in designing and creating resources.

types.name: Contract
types.description: A smart contract on the blockchain. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/contract).

fields.name: address
fields.description: The address at which this contract is deployed.

fields.name: blockchain
fields.description: The blockchain in which this contract is deployed.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of this contract.

inputFields.name: contentType
inputFields.description: The Content-Type (MIME type) of the file to be uploaded. This must match the Content-Type header you will use to upload the file to the returned URL. If this is left empty, your Content-Type header must also be empty.

inputFields.name: posterFileId
inputFields.description: Required if the file to be uploaded is a video, and uploadToIPFS=true. In that case a poster must have already been uploaded (so it can be used as the image on IPFS).

inputFields.name: uploadToIPFS
inputFields.description: Whether to asynchronously trigger an IPFS upload after the file has been uploaded to the returned cloud storage URL.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: CreateWalletInput
types.description: The input to create wallet data [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}).

inputFields.name: attributes
inputFields.description: A mapping of attributes for this resource. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

types.name: Currency
types.description: A currency that can be accepted for payment.

enumValues.name: USD
enumValues.description: The United States dollar.

types.name: EmailAddress
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard internet email address format as specified in RFC822: https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc822/.

types.name: File
types.description: An interface containing common data about files.

fields.name: contentType
fields.description: The MIME content type for this file.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this file in the Niftory API.

fields.name: md5
fields.description: The MD5 hash of this file.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A friendly name for the file.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The upload state of the file.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The cloud storage URL for this file. If state is GENERATED_UPLOAD_URL, then this url is the presigned URL to upload to.

types.name: FileState
types.description: The upload state of a File.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: The file failed to ready.

enumValues.name: GENERATED_UPLOAD_URL
enumValues.description: Niftory has created a pre-signed URL where the file can be uploaded.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: Niftory has created a file entry in the database table.

enumValues.name: READY
enumValues.description: The file is ready for use.

enumValues.name: UPLOADED_TO_CLOUD_STORAGE
enumValues.description: The file has been uploaded to a cloud storage for fast retrieval.

enumValues.name: UPLOADED_TO_IPFS
enumValues.description: The file (and potentially its corresponding metadata) have been uploaded to IPFS.

types.name: FixedPricing
types.description: A simple pricing strategy for listings with fixed prices.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: The currency at which this price is set.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price in the specified currency at which this item is for sale.

types.name: Identifiable
types.description: An interface representing objects with unique IDs

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

types.name: Invoice
types.description: A purchase invoice for an NFT. The invoice is created when an NFT is reserved using reserve, and updated when a payment is initiated with checkout

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the Niftory invoice for an NFT purchase

fields.name: listingId
fields.description: The listing associated with this invoice

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of this invoice

fields.name: total
fields.description: The total spent in USD in this invoice

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The user id associated with this invoice

types.name: InvoiceList
types.description: A list of completed invoices for this app

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page of results, if any.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The invoices in this list.

types.name: InvoiceState
types.description: The state of an invoice.

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: This invoice is completed.

enumValues.name: CREATED
enumValues.description: This invoice was created and ready for payment.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error was encountered while performing this payment.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: This invoice is pending payment.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: ListingState
types.description: The state of a listing.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE
enumValues.description: The listing is active and available for sale.

enumValues.name: INACTIVE
enumValues.description: The listing is inactive, so it's not open for sale.

enumValues.name: SOLD
enumValues.description: All NFTs in this listing have been sold.

fields.name: createFileUploadUrl
fields.description: Generates a pre-signed URL that can then be used to upload a file. Once the file has been uploaded to the URL, it will automatically be uploaded to IPFS (if desired). Use the returned [File]({{Types.SimpleFile}}).state to track the upload.

args.name: description
args.description: Description about the file. If specified, and uploadToIpfs=true, this description will be added to the IPFS file metadata.

args.name: name
args.description: A friendly name for the file.

args.name: options
args.description: File upload options, such as whether to upload to IPFS.

fields.name: createNFTModel
fields.description: Creates a new [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}}).

args.name: data
args.description: The data to create the NFTModel.

args.name: setId
args.description: The ID of the [NFTSet]({{Types.NFTSet}}) that this model should belong to. This can be created using [createNFTSet]({{Mutations.createSet}}) or retrieved using This can be created using [sets]({{Queries.sets}}).

fields.name: createNFTSet
fields.description: Creates a new [NFTSet]({{Types.NFTSet}}).

args.name: data
args.description: The input data for the NFTSet.

fields.name: createNiftoryWallet
fields.description: Provisions a custodial Niftory [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) and, if specified, associates it with the given [AppUser]({{Types.AppUser}}). Note: The call fails if the user already has a wallet.

args.name: userId
args.description: The ID of the [AppUser]({{Types.AppUser}}) to associate with the created Wallet. If unspecified, the caller is responsible for mapping the Wallet to their user.

fields.name: mintNFTModel
fields.description: Initiates minting for a given [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTmodel}}).

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTmodel}}) to mint [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s from.

args.name: quantity
args.description: The number of NFTs to mint. Defaults to minting all NFTs in the model. If quantity exceeds the quantity defined in the model, the latter is used.

fields.name: readyWallet
fields.description: Marks a [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) as ready, indicating that the wallet is ready to receive [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s from the app's [Contract]({{Types.Contract}}). The wallet must be verified before this succeeds. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/wallets/set-up-wallets).

args.name: address
args.description: The address of the wallet.

fields.name: registerWallet
fields.description: Registers a [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) to the currently signed-in user. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/wallets/set-up-wallets).

args.name: address
args.description: The address of the wallet.

fields.name: transfer
fields.description: Initiates the transfer of an [NFT]({{Types.NFT}}) to the currently-logged in [AppUser]({{Types.AppUser}}). The NFT is reserved for the user in database, and you can use the NFT.status field to check on the transfer progress.

args.name: address
args.description: The address of the [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) to filter by. This mutation requires the `userId`, `walletId' or the wallet `address` to be specified.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}}) to send.

args.name: nftModelId
args.description: Used if NFT ID is unspecified to randomly select an NFT from the [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}})

args.name: userId
args.description: The ID of the [AppUser]({{Types.AppUser}}) to send the NFT to. This mutation requires the `userId`, `walletId' or the wallet `address` to be specified.

args.name: walletId
args.description: The database ID of the [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) to filter by. This mutation requires the `userId`, `walletId' or the wallet `address` to be specified.

fields.name: updateNFTModel
fields.description: Updates an existing [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}}). Note that if this NFTModel has already been used to mint an NFT, the update operation will fail for any properties that affect the blockchain (such as 'quantity', 'title', 'metadata', etc.), whereas updating 'attributes' will succeed.

args.name: data
args.description: The data to update the NFTModel.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the NFT model to update.

fields.name: updateNFTSet
fields.description: Updates an existing [NFTSet]({{Types.NFTSet}}).

args.name: data
args.description: The input data for the NFTSet.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the NFTSet to update.

fields.name: updateWallet
fields.description: Update a [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) of the currently signed-in user. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/wallets/set-up-wallets).

args.name: address
args.description: The address of the wallet.

fields.name: uploadNFTContent
fields.description: Creates an [NFTContent]({{Types.NFTContent}}) object containing pre-signed URLs that can then be used to upload a file and poster. The primary file will automatically be uploaded to IPFS once it's been uploaded to the pre-signed URL. Each returned [File]({{Types.SimpleFile}}) has a 'state' property to track the upload.

args.name: contentType
args.description: The Content-Type (MIME type) of the file to be uploaded. This must match the Content-Type header you will use to upload the file to the returned URL. If this is left empty, your Content-Type header must also be empty.

args.name: description
args.description: Description about the file. If specified, this description will be added to the IPFS file metadata.

args.name: name
args.description: A friendly name for the file.

args.name: posterContentType
args.description: The Content-Type (MIME type) of the poster file to be uploaded. This must match the Content-Type header you will use to upload the poster to the returned URL. If this is left empty, your Content-Type header must also be empty.

fields.name: verifyWallet
fields.description: Verifies a [Wallet]({{Types.Wallet}}) to the currently signed-in user. If the signed verification code fails to decode with the wallet's public key or doesn't match the wallet's verification code, the request will fail. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/wallets/set-up-wallets).

args.name: address
args.description: The address of the wallet.

args.name: signedVerificationCode
args.description: The verification code of the wallet signed by the wallet's private key.

types.name: NFT
types.description: Respresentation of a [non-fungible token](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-fungible_token) in the Niftory ecosystem (it doesn't have to be minted on the blockchain yet). Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/nfts).

fields.name: blockchainId
fields.description: The ID of this resource on the blockchain.

fields.name: blockchainState
fields.description: The state of this NFT on the blockchain

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: A mapping of properties that will be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: model
fields.description: The model from which this NFT was created.

fields.name: saleState
fields.description: This state of this object's sale.

fields.name: serialNumber
fields.description: The serial number for this NFT within its model.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this NFT (e.g. if it is available or being transferred to a user

fields.name: wallet
fields.description: The wallet containing this NFT, if it is owned by a user.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: NFTBlockchainState
types.description: The state of an NFT on the blockchain.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error occurred with this item's last blockchain operation.

enumValues.name: MINTED
enumValues.description: The item is minted, and are no pending operations on it.

enumValues.name: MINTING
enumValues.description: The item is being minted.

enumValues.name: TRANSFERRED
enumValues.description: The item has already been transferred to a user's wallet.

enumValues.name: TRANSFERRING
enumValues.description: The item is being transferred.

enumValues.name: UNMINTED
enumValues.description: The item hasn't been minted yet.

types.name: NFTContent
types.description: The content for an NFT.

fields.name: files
fields.description: The file content in this NFT.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: poster
fields.description: The poster file for this NFT's content

types.name: NFTContentInput
types.description: The input to create or update [NFTContent]({{Types.NFTContent}}).

inputFields.name: fileId
inputFields.description: The ID of the [NFTFile]({{Types.NFTFile}}) content. This can be created using [createFileUploadUrl]({{Mutations.createFileUploadUrl}}).

inputFields.name: posterId
inputFields.description: The ID of the poster [File]({{Types.File}}). This can be created using [createFileUploadUrl]({{Mutations.createFileUploadUrl}}).

types.name: NFTFile
types.description: File (with ipfsContentUrl and ipfsMetadataUrl). A file to be included in an NFT. Extends [File]({{Types.File}}) to includes the IPFS addresses for the content and metadata.

fields.name: contentType
fields.description: The MIME content type for this file.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this file in the Niftory API.

fields.name: ipfsContentAddress
fields.description: The IPFS address for the content of this file.

fields.name: ipfsMetadataAddress
fields.description: The IPFS address for the metadata of this file.

fields.name: md5
fields.description: The MD5 hash of this file.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A friendly name for the file.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The upload state of the file.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The cloud storage URL for this file. If state is GENERATED_UPLOAD_URL, then this url is the presigned URL to upload to.

types.name: NFTFilterInput
types.description: Properties to filter [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s by when querying them.

inputFields.name: blockchainIds
inputFields.description: Blockchain IDs of the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s to find.

inputFields.name: blockchainStates
inputFields.description: Blockchain states of the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s to find. Defaults to all.

inputFields.name: ids
inputFields.description: Database IDs of the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s to find.

inputFields.name: nftModelIds
inputFields.description: The IDs of the [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}}) that the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}}) should belong to.

inputFields.name: saleStates
inputFields.description: Sale states of the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s to find. Defaults to all.

inputFields.name: transferStates
inputFields.description: Transfer states of the [NFT]({{Types.NFT}})s to find. Defaults to all.

types.name: NFTList
types.description: A list of NFTs.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page of results, if any.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The NFTs in this list.

types.name: NFTListing
types.description: A listing of NFTs for sale.

fields.name: appId
fields.description: The appId of the app this NFTListing belongs to.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the listing.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: nftModel
fields.description: The NFT Model for this listing, NFTs from this model will be sold when a user checks out with this listing

fields.name: pricing

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of this listing.

fields.name: title

inputFields.name: ids

inputFields.name: state
inputFields.description: The ID of the NFTModel that the NFTListing should belong to.

inputFields.name: title

types.name: NFTListingList
types.description: A list of NFTListings.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page of results, if any.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The NFTListings in this list.

types.name: NFTModel
types.description: The blueprint for an NFT, containing everything needed to mint one -- file content, blockchain metadata, etc. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/nfts).

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: blockchainId
fields.description: The ID of this resource on the blockchain.

fields.name: content
fields.description: This NFT model's content.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The user-friendly description for this model.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: A mapping of properties that will be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: nfts
fields.description: The NFTs created using this model.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: The total quantity of NFTs that will be available for this model.

fields.name: rarity
fields.description: The rarity of the NFTs in this model.

fields.name: set
fields.description: The NFT model set containing this model.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of this NFT Model on the blockchain

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this resource. Can be used to track progress in designing and creating resources.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The user-friendly title for this model.

types.name: NFTModelBlockchainState
types.description: The state of an NFT Model on the blockchain.

enumValues.name: COMPLETED
enumValues.description: All NFTs in this model have been transferred to users.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error occurred with this item's last blockchain operation.

enumValues.name: MINTED
enumValues.description: The item is minted, and are no pending operations on it.

enumValues.name: MINTING
enumValues.description: The item is being minted.

enumValues.name: UNMINTED
enumValues.description: The item hasn't been minted yet.

types.name: NFTModelCreateInput
types.description: The input to create an [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}}).

inputFields.name: attributes
inputFields.description: A mapping of attributes for this resource. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

inputFields.name: content
inputFields.description: The file content for this model. Either 'content' or 'contentId' must be specified.

inputFields.name: contentId
inputFields.description: The ID of the [NFTContent]({{Types.NFTContent}}) for this model. Either 'content' or 'contentId' must be specified.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The user-friendly details about this model. This will be added to the blockchain metadata when an NFT is minted.

inputFields.name: metadata
inputFields.description: Metadata that will be added to the blockchain for any NFTs minted from this model.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The total supply of NFTs that can be available for this model. This can be updated until the NFTModel is minted.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: The status of the model.

inputFields.name: subtitle
inputFields.description: The user-friendly subtitle for this model. This will be added to the blockchain metadata when an NFT is minted.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The user-friendly title for this model. This will be added to the blockchain metadata when an NFT is minted.

types.name: NFTModelFilterInput
types.description: Properties to filter [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}})s when querying them.

inputFields.name: blockchainIds
inputFields.description: Blockchain IDs of the [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}})s to find.

inputFields.name: ids
inputFields.description: Database IDs of the [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}})s to find.

inputFields.name: setIds
inputFields.description: The IDs of the [NFTSet]({{Types.NFTSet}})s that the [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}}) should belong to.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description: Filter by [NFTModel]({{Types.NFTModel}}) status.

types.description: A list of NFTModels.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page of results, if any.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The NFTModels in this list.

inputFields.name: attributes
inputFields.description: A mapping of attributes for this resource. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

inputFields.name: content
inputFields.description: The file content for this model. This can be updated until the NFTModel is minted.

inputFields.name: contentId
inputFields.description: The ID of the [NFTContent]({{Types.NFTContent}}) for this model.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The user-friendly details about this model. This will be added to the blockchain metadata when an NFT is minted.

inputFields.name: metadata
inputFields.description: Metadata that will be added to the blockchain for any NFTs minted from this model. This can be updated until the NFTModel is minted

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The total supply of NFTs that can be available for this model. This can be updated until the NFTModel is minted.

inputFields.name: status

inputFields.name: subtitle
inputFields.description: The user-friendly subtitle for this model. This will be added to the blockchain metadata when an NFT is minted.

types.name: NFTSet
types.description: A set of NFTModels, to help you organize your NFTs. Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/nfts).

fields.name: app
fields.description: The app this set belongs to.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: blockchainId
fields.description: The ID of this resource on the blockchain.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image to represent this set.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: A mapping of properties that will be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: models
fields.description: Models contained in this set.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of this NFT Set on the blockchain

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this resource. Can be used to track progress in designing and creating resources.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The display image for this set.

types.name: NFTSetBlockchainState
types.description: The state of an NFT Set on the blockchain.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error occurred with this item's last blockchain operation.

enumValues.name: MINTED
enumValues.description: The item is minted, and are no pending operations on it.

enumValues.name: MINTING
enumValues.description: The item is being minted.

enumValues.name: UNMINTED
enumValues.description: The item hasn't been minted yet.

types.name: Resource
types.description: An interface representing properties common to all user-managed resources in the Niftory API.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this resource. Can be used to track progress in designing and creating resources.

types.name: SaleState
types.description: The state of an item being sold.

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The item has not been reserved or purchased yet.

enumValues.name: FULFILLED
enumValues.description: The item has been delivered.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The item has been paid for and is being fulfilled.

enumValues.name: RESERVED
enumValues.description: The item is reserved for a future purchase.

types.name: SellableEntity
types.description: An interface representing properties common to all objects that can be bought and sold

fields.name: saleState
fields.description: This state of this object's sale.

types.name: SimpleFile
types.description: A file uploaded to the Niftory API.

fields.name: contentType
fields.description: The MIME content type for this file.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this file in the Niftory API.

fields.name: md5
fields.description: The MD5 hash of this file.

fields.name: name
fields.description: A friendly name for the file.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The upload state of the file.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The cloud storage URL for this file. If state is GENERATED_UPLOAD_URL, then this url is the presigned URL to upload to.

types.name: SimpleRarityLevel
types.description: The default rarity levels in the Niftory API.

enumValues.name: COMMON
enumValues.description: The most common NFTs.

enumValues.name: LEGENDARY
enumValues.description: The rarest of the rare NFTs, for the most dedicated collectors.

enumValues.name: RARE
enumValues.description: These are rarer, harder to get and more expensive.

types.name: Status
types.description: Status of this resource for user workflows.

enumValues.name: DONE
enumValues.description: "Here you go!"

enumValues.name: DRAFT
enumValues.description: "I'm just getting started."

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: "I'm working on it!"

enumValues.name: TO_DO
enumValues.description: "I'll get to it eventually..."

types.name: TransferState
types.description: The state of an item being transferred.

enumValues.name: AVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The item has been created, but not transferred.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: The item failed to transfer.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: The item is being transferred.

enumValues.name: RESERVED
enumValues.description: The item is reserved for a future transfer.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: The item has been transferred.

types.name: Wallet
types.description: Represents a blockchain wallet scoped to a particular [App]({{Types.App}}) and [AppUser]({{Types.AppUser}}). Read more [here](https://docs.niftory.com/home/v/api/core-concepts/wallets).

fields.name: address
fields.description: This wallet's address on the blockchain.

fields.name: appUser
fields.description: The User who owns the wallet

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A mapping of attributes for this object. These will be stored in the Niftory API but will not be added to the blockchain.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for this object in the Niftory API.

fields.name: nfts
fields.description: The NFTs from the current app that are in this wallet.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of this wallet.

fields.name: verificationCode
fields.description: The verification code that can be used to verify this wallet for this user.

types.name: WalletList
types.description: A list of Wallets.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: The cursor to use to fetch the next page of results, if any.

fields.name: items
fields.description: The Wallets in this list.

types.name: WalletState
types.description: The state of a wallet.

enumValues.name: CREATION_FAILED
enumValues.description: (Custodial Wallet Only) The Niftory custodial wallet failed to be created on the blockchain.

enumValues.name: PENDING_CREATION
enumValues.description: (Custodial Wallet Only) The Niftory custodial wallet is in the process of being created on-chain. The address and state of the Wallet object will be updated once complete.

enumValues.name: READY
enumValues.description: The wallet is ready to receive NFTs from this app's contract.

enumValues.name: UNVERIFIED
enumValues.description: The wallet has been registered with Niftory, but not yet verified to belong to the signed-in user.

enumValues.name: VERIFIED
enumValues.description: The wallet is verified to belong to the signed-in user, but not yet ready to receive NFTs from this app's contract.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
